sentence.Network_en: Mentioning her ex-husband was a bit of a clanger.
sentence.Network_cn: 提及她的前夫是有点令人难堪的失言。

sentence.Network_en: I dropped a real clanger when I mentioned the party. He hadn't been invited.
sentence.Network_cn: 我无意中失言提起了聚会的事情,而他并没有被邀请.

sentence.Network_en: She dropped a clanger when she mentioned the broken window.
sentence.Network_cn: 她提到打碎的窗子时说得真不是时候.

GRE(红宝书) - English 考研论坛 ... clampdown n. 对言行的限制或禁止 clanger n. 明显的错误 claustrophobia n. 幽闭恐怖症.
He dropped a clanger ., 他弄了个大笑话.

entry.tran: 蠢事;失言;失礼;尴尬的错误
entry.def: You can refer to something stupid or embarrassing that someone does or says as a clanger .

means.word_mean: 1. a conspicuous mistake whose effects seem to reverberate;

auth_sentence.content: I regret to report that the Inspectorate of Dropped Clangers yes, he means me has itself dropped a clanger.
